title: Marine Le Pen casts near-misses for National Rally as seeds of ‘tomorrow’s victory’
France election live updates: Left-wing bloc leads in surprise projections
content: The populist, anti-immigration National Rally party had been hoping to install France’s first far-right government since World War II, with 28-year-old Jordan Bardella as prime minister.
summary: The populist, anti-immigration National Rally party had been hoping to install France’s first far-right government since World War II, with 28-year-old Jordan Bardella as prime minister.

title: Iranian reformist wins presidency, seeks engagement with the West
content: Iran’s new president Masoud Pezeshkian campaigned on modest social reforms and talks with the United States over the country’s nuclear program.
summary: Iran’s new president Masoud Pezeshkian campaigned on modest social reforms and talks with the United States over the country’s nuclear program.

title: France’s Jordan Bardella, the immigrant’s son who would target migrants
content: If his party wins Sunday’s election, Bardella would become France’s first far-right head of government since World War II.
summary: If his party wins Sunday’s election, Bardella would become France’s first far-right head of government since World War II.
